The written statement disclosing such communication shall include the following information: 
a.  The name, address and telephone number to whom the communication was made. 
b.  The date, time, and duration of the communication, and the circumstances under which it was made. 
c.  A brief statement describing any oral communication. 
d.  A copy of any written materials which were subject to the communications. 
e.  Such disclosure statements shall be filed within thirty (30) days after passage of the ordinance from which this article derived. These statements shall cover the period from January 1, 1982, to the date of said ordinance. Additional statements supporting the information initially filed shall be filed on the last day of each quarter calendar thereafter until three (3) months have passed after the award of any franchise for which the franchisee applied. 
f.  Each grantee shall make disclosures, consistent with the provision and intent of this article, regarding changes of ownership, interest, representatives, expenditures, and other matters relating to cable T.V. communications during the term of the franchise. Nothing herein shall be construed to prevent the village manager or the village board from requiring disclosure of information in addition to that needed to comply with the terms of this article. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-204. - Representatives—Prohibitions. 
Representatives shall not directly or indirectly, knowingly: 
(1)  Provide, offer, promise, suggest or otherwise communicate the possible provision of an interest to a village employee, to any family member of the village employee, to a village advisor, family member of a village advisor, to a village representative, family member of a village representative, or to a person with whom a village representative maintains a close economic association. 
(2)  Communicate with a village employee in violation of the restriction on ex parte communication provided by section 7.5-208 of this article. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-205. - Same—Registration and disclosure. 
(a)  All representatives shall register with the village manager within thirty (30) days of passage of the ordinance from which this article derived, or before engaging in any activities as a representative, whichever is later. 
(b)  Any franchisee may register on behalf of all representatives who are full-time employees of itself and of any parent, subsidiary, or affiliated corporation. Each franchisee shall be responsible for informing all its representatives of the provisions of this article in a timely manner, and for ensuring that all its representatives comply with the provisions of this article. 
(c)  Registration shall consist of filing with the village manager a written statement by the representative, or by the franchisee in case of representatives who are its full-time employees, subscribed under oath before a notary public, publicly disclosing the following information: 
(1)  The name and business address of the representative. 
(2)  The name and address of any firm or any business or professional association with which an individual representative is employed or otherwise affiliated, or in the case of the representative which is a firm or other entity, the name and addresses of any individuals who perform any activities as a representative. 
(3)  The name and address of the franchisee on whose behalf the representative acts or will act. 
(4)  The name and address of any person employing, retaining, or paying the representative to act on behalf of the franchisee. 
(5)  All expenditures by the representative on behalf of the franchisee, at any time since January 1, 1982, itemized by category and amount, and identifying the person to whom each amount of money or other expenditures were directly or indirectly paid relating to any cable T.V. franchise in the village. 
(6)  All communications by the representatives, on behalf of the franchisee with a village employee, family member of a village employee, village advisor, family member of a village advisor, village representative, family member or a village representative or person with whom a village representative maintains a close economic association at any time since January 1, 1982. 
(d)  Additional registration statements supplementing the information initially filed shall be filed within thirty (30) days of passage of the ordinance from which this article derived and on the first day of each quarter calendar thereafter until three (3) months have passed after the award of any franchise for which the franchisee applied. If the representative made no expenditures or communications on behalf of the franchisee subsequent to those previously disclosed, the representative shall file and so state in the additional registration statement. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-206. - Village employees, advisors and representatives—Prohibitions. 
(a)  No village employee, village advisor, village representative, or member of his or her family shall have an interest exceeding one per cent in a franchisee except as permitted under section 7.5-202 hereof. 
(b)  No village employee or member of his family shall, directly or indirectly: 
(1)  Solicit or accept an interest in, expenditure from, or any other thing of value or transaction conferring an economic benefit, from a franchisee representative. 
(2)  Solicit, request from or recommend to any franchisee, or representative, the appointment of any person to a place or position, or the provision of an interest, expenditure, or any other thing of value or transaction conferring an economic benefit, to any person. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-207. - Same—Disclosure. 
(a)  Each village representative and advisor shall file with the village manager a written statement, described under oath before a notary public, publicly disclosing the following information: 
(1)  All interests or other economic relationships which the village representative or a member of his family has or had at any time since January 1, 1982, in any franchisee. 
(2)  All interests which the village representative knows have been held, at any time since January 1, 1982, in any franchisee by a family member or by a person with whom the village representative maintains a close economic association. 
(3)  All interests or other economic relationships which the village advisor or a member of his family has or had at any time since January 1, 1982, in any franchisee. 
(4)  All communications, direct or indirect, which the village representative, or member of his family, or advisor, at any time since January 1, 1982, has had with the franchisee, any such communication relating in any way to cable communications in the village with a person who has a direct economic interest in the award of a franchisee, outside of meetings held under the Open Meetings Act, and other public meetings regarding cable T.V. franchise. 
(b)  With respect to each of the interests or other economic relationships described in subparagraph (1), (2) and (3) of this section, the written statement shall contain: 
(1)  The name and address of the person who has had, and that person's relationship to the village representative or advisor. 
(2)  The dates any interest was acquired and held. 
(3)  The amount and nature of the interest, and a description of the transaction in which it was acquired. 
(4)  The name and address of the person in whom the interest is or was had. 
(c)  Village representatives and advisors shall file their disclosure statements within thirty (30) days after passage of the ordinance from which this article derived. Additional statements supplementing the information initially filed shall be filed on the first day of each quarter calendar hereafter until three (3) months have passed after the award of all cable franchisees in the village. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-208. - Ex parte communications. 
(a)  No franchisee, or person who supplies materials or services to a franchisee, shall directly or indirectly communicate with a village employee concerning any matter relating in any way to cable communications in the village, other than in the franchise negotiating process, except in writing addressed to the village manager, 20 S. Ardmore Avenue, Villa Park, II, 60181. All responses on behalf of the village or any village employee to such communications shall be in writing and filed with the village manager. The village manager shall maintain and coordinate all such communications and responses in his office, available for public inspection during regular business hours. 
(b)  The foregoing shall not apply to communications consisting exclusively of: 
(1)  Requests for schedule of meetings. 
(2)  Requests for information regarding procedural matters not in dispute. 
(3)  Any meetings held under the Open Meeting Act. 
(4)  Negotiations or other discussions with franchisees publicly authorized by the village board. 
(5)  Communications through the public media, such as statements in news interviews and in paid advertisements. In addition, nothing in this section shall preclude the village board from publicly designating the village manager to respond to inquiries from franchisees concerning ascertainment of the needs of each department for possible use of the cable communications system. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-209. - Village manager's responsibilities. 
(a)  Not less than thirty (30) days before the due date for filing the initial statement required by these sections, the village manager shall send a written notice to each village representative of his or her responsibility to file such a statement. 
(b)  All statements and reports are filed in his office pursuant to this article. 
(c)  All statements, reports, listings, and other documents filed pursuant to this article shall be available for examination and copying by the public during regular business hours. A reasonable fee may be charged for copies. Each person requesting to examine a statement, report, or other document filed pursuant to this article must fill out a form identifying the examiner and the person on whose behalf the examination is being conducted by name, address, occupation, and telephone number, and listing the documents to be examined and the date of examination. 
(d)  The village manager shall notify the village board of any alleged or apparent violations of this article, and any reports or investigations relating thereto. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
Sec. 7.5-210. - Additional penalties. 
In addition to any other remedies provided by this article or other applicable law, violations of the provisions of this article shall be subject to the following additional penalties: 
(1)  Violations of sections 7.5-203 through 7.5-206 may render a franchisee ineligible for a franchise, and may render any franchise ordinance or other village action relating to the franchisee voidable. 
(2)  When a village employee, village advisor, village representative, family member of the above, a person with whom a village representative maintains a close economic association acquires or otherwise has an interest in the franchisee, the village board may revoke any franchise held by the franchisee. 
(3)  When an interest in a franchise is acquired or otherwise held by a person who, within twenty (20) months prior to obtaining such interest, was a village representative, a family member of a village representative, or a person with whom a village representative maintains a close economic relationship, any franchise held by the grantee may be voidable. 
(4)  Any person who knowingly violates any provision of this article shall be subject to a fine as provided in section 1-108 for each offense. Each day of the violation shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 2059, § 1, 2-7-83)  
ARTICLE III. - COMMUNITY ANTENNA TELEVISION SYSTEMS[3] 

Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 2103, adopted March 19, 1984 provided for the addition of a new Art. II, §§ 26-203—26-229 to the Code. In order to keep related material together, the editor has redesignated said provisions as a new Art. III, §§ 7.5-301—7.5-327. 
Cross reference— Table of franchises, App. A. 
 
Sec. 7.5-301. - Purpose. 
The purpose of this article is to provide for the granting of nonexclusive franchises to construct, operate and maintain broadband communications networks (community antenna television systems) in the public ways of the Village of Villa Park; to provide for the specifications, procedures and standards for the same; to provide for the regulation of such networks; and to provide for the payment to the village for the privilege of exercising the rights granted by such franchises. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-302. - Definitions. 
The following terms, phrases and words and their derivatives shall have the meaning specified herein in connection with this article: 
(a)  Affiliates of another person shall mean: 
(1)  Any person directly or indirectly owning, controlling, or holding with power to vote, five (5) per centum or more of the outstanding voting securities of such other person; 
(2)  Any person five (5) per centum or more of whose outstanding voting securities are directly or indirectly owned, controlled, or held with power to vote, by such other person; 
(3)  Any person directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by, or under common control with, such other person; and 
(4)  Any officer, director, partner, co-partner, agent, joint-adventurer, or executive employee of such other person. 
(b)  Annual gross revenues shall mean all revenues received by the grantee, its affiliates, and/or subsidiaries from and in connection with the operation of the "broadband telecommunications network" (BTN) in the Village of Villa Park, and all revenues generated by such BTN or from the use of such BTN, including, but not limited to, retail sales of personal property, data transmission, alarm or signal transmission, advertising revenue, charges to, subscribers for basic service, pay service, two-way service, installation charges, and any and all revenue received from any source whatsoever for use of the BTN for the transmission of electronic or microwave impulses, provided that such revenue may lawfully be included in the base on which the village may calculate the franchise fee herein. Sales taxes or other taxes for fees which are separately billed to subscribers by the grantee or which are collected from subscribers by the grantee or which are collected from subscribers for remittance to a governmental agency or other third party are excluded from the term "annual gross revenues." 
(c)  Basic service shall mean the service package offered by the grantee to subscribers which includes (but which is not necessarily limited to) the signals referred to in section 7.5-309(a) and at least one municipal access channel, at least one educational access channel, and at least one public interest channel. If more than one service package meets the foregoing conditions, then the service package which is offered at the lowest rate shall constitute the basic service. 
(d)  Board or village board shall mean the board of trustees of the Village of Villa Park. 
(e)  Broadband telecommunications network (BTN) shall mean all of the component physical operational and programming elements of any network of cables, optical, electrical or electronic equipment, including cable television, designed, constructed, wired or used for the purpose of producing, receiving, amplifying and transmitting by coaxial cable, fiber optics, microwave or other means, audio and/or audio-visual electrical impulses of television, radio and other intelligences, either analog or digital, for sale or use by the inhabitants of the village, including, without limitation, antenna, cables, wires, lines, towers, amplifiers, conductors, converters, equipment and facilities, and shall include within its meaning what is known as a "community antenna television system." 
(f)  Commence operation shall mean that time and date when operation of the BTN is considered to have commenced, which shall be when sufficient distribution facilities have been installed so as to permit the offering of full network service to at least twenty (20) per cent of the potential subscribers in the franchise territory. 
(g)  Community antenna television system shall mean "community antenna television system" as defined in Section 11-42-11 of the Illinois Municipal Code. 
(h)  FCC shall mean the Federal Communications Commission and any legally appointed, elected, or established successor with respect to federal regulation and licensing in connection with the subject matter of this article. 
(i)  Franchise shall mean the nonexclusive rights granted pursuant to this article to construct and operate a broadband telecommunications network along the public ways within all or a specified area in the village. Any such authorization, in whatever form granted, shall not mean and include any license or permit required for the privilege of transacting and carrying on a business within the village as required by other codes, ordinances and laws of this village. 
(j)  Full network service shall mean basic service and all pay services. The term does not include two-way service. 
(k)  Grantee shall mean any person receiving a franchise pursuant to this article and under the granting franchise ordinance, its present subsidiaries and affiliates, and its lawful successor, transferee or assignee. 
(l)  May is permissive. 
(m)  Pay service shall mean any service package for which a monthly or other service charge is made. 
(n)  Person shall mean an individual, partnership, limited partnership, association, organization, corporation or any lawful successor, transferee or assignee of the same. 
(o)  Schools means all public, parochial and private, elementary and secondary school, junior colleges, colleges and universities located or operating within the Village of Villa Park and which have been granted a certificate of recognition by the State of Illinois. 
(p)  Reasonable notice shall be written notice addressed to the grantee at its office, which notice shall be certified and postmarked not less than four (4) days prior to the day in which the party giving such notice shall commence any action which requires the giving of notice. In computing said four (4) days, Saturdays, Sundays and holidays recognized by the village shall be excluded. 
(q)  Sale shall include any sale, exchange, barter or offer for sale. 
(r)  Service package shall mean one or more communications channels which are offered as a unit by the grantee to subscribers and for which a separately identifiable charge is made. 
(s)  Shall and Must: Each is mandatory and not merely directory. 
(t)  Start construction and/or Commencement of construction shall mean the act of initiating the laying, installing or stringing of cable, wires, or lines upon, under or above streets. 
(u)  Street shall include each of the following which have been dedicated to the public or is hereafter dedicated to the public and maintained under public authority or by others and located within the village limits: Streets, roadways, highways, avenues, lanes, alleys, sidewalks, easements, rights-of-way, and similar public ways and extensions and additions thereto, together with such other public property and areas that the village shall permit to be included within the definition of "street" from time to time. 
(v)  Subscriber shall mean any person receiving a service package. 
(w)  Substantially completed shall occur when sufficient distribution facilities have been installed by the grantee so as to permit the offering of full network service to at least ninety (90) per cent of the potential subscribers in the franchise territory. 
(x)  System shall mean "community antenna television system" as defined in Section 11-42-11 of the Illinois Municipal Code, and as amended from time to time. 
(y)  Two-way service shall mean any service which involves the transmission of a signal from a subscriber to a facility maintained by the grantee as part of the BTN. This term includes (but is not limited to) fire, security and medical alert systems. 
(z)  Village shall mean the Village of Villa Park, a municipal corporation of the State of Illinois. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-303. - Franchise requirement; authority granted by a franchise. 
(a)  Franchise required. No person shall construct, install, maintain or operate on or within any street, any equipment, facilities or system for the distribution of television signals or radio signals or other intelligences, either analog or digital, over a BTN to any subscriber unless a franchise authorizing the use of the streets has first been obtained pursuant to the provisions of this article; and thereafter, only while said person is legally operating under the terms and provisions of said franchise. 
(b)  Authority granted. Any franchise granted hereunder shall give to the grantee, subject to the provisions of this article, the right and privilege at its own expense, to construct, erect, operate, modify and maintain in, upon, along, above, over and under the streets, such towers, antennas, cables, electronic equipment, and other network appurtenances as are necessary for the operation of a BTN (community antenna television system) in the village. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-304. - Terms and conditions for each franchise. 
(a)  Franchise nonexclusive. Any franchise granted hereunder shall not be exclusive. The village reserves the right to grant other franchises to other persons at any time or times. 
(b)  Term of franchise. Each franchise granted under this article shall take effect and be in force as provided herein for a term of fifteen (15) years from the effective date as provided in section 7.5-305(e) subject, however, to the right of the village to terminate said franchise as provided herein. 
(c)  Noninterference with use of streets. The right and privilege granted by a franchise shall be exercised so as not to interfere with the use of the streets by the village and such others as may be designated by the village to use such streets, and the village may demand the removal of any cables or equipment as have been constructed by the grantee when the village has reasonable grounds to believe that such is interfering with the use of the streets. 
(d)  Transfer of franchise. 
(1)  No franchise granted hereunder may be sold, transferred, leased, assigned, or disposed of, whether by way of sale, merger, consolidation, or otherwise, without in each case the prior written consent of the village, and then only under such conditions as the village may establish. Such consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. 
(2)  Notwithstanding the provisions of section 7.5-304(d)(1), a franchise may be mortgaged, pledged or assigned as security for the financing of the related BTN. Such mortgage, pledge or assignment may be made without the consent of the village, but any such mortgage, pledge or assignment shall be subject to the terms and conditions of the franchise and the related franchise agreement and to the rights of the village under this chapter, provided however, any franchise agreement may include for the benefit of the village right of first refusal and purchase provisions. 
(3)  Reference is made to section 7.5-304(i)(1) for the effect of changes in ownership or control of the grantee and to section 7.5-304(i)(2) for rules covering control of a BTN by a financial institution. 
(4)  Reference is made to section 7.5-317 for transfers in connection with insolvency proceedings. 
(e)  Franchise territory. Each franchise granted hereunder shall relate to the territorial limits of the village, or such lesser area as may be designated by the village board, and to any area henceforth added thereto during the term of the franchise. Subject to section 7.5-310 hereof, the grantee shall be required to extend the BTN to and to offer the services of the BTN to potential subscribers within the franchise territory where there are at least a total of forty (40) residential dwelling units and/or occupied commercial or industrial structures per line mile. 
Where the density of residential dwelling and occupied commercial or industrial structures, adverse terrain, or other factors render extension of the system and offer of services impractical or technically unfeasible or creates a substantial economic hardship, the village may upon petition of the grantee either waive the extension and offer of services on such special terms, conditions and provisions as are reasonable and fair to the village, the grantee and potential subscribers in such areas. 
(f)  Privileges must be specified. No privilege or exemption shall be granted or conferred by any franchise granted except those specifically prescribed herein. 
(g)  Obligations of grantee to obtain other permits. Any franchise granted hereunder shall not relieve the grantee of any obligations involved in obtaining pole or conduit space from any department of the village, utility company, or from others maintaining utilities in streets. 
(h)  Franchise binding. Any franchise granted hereunder shall be binding upon the grantee, and all successors, lessees, or assignees as may be approved by the village. 
(i)  Transaction affecting ownership or control. 
(1)  Express approval of the village board, which shall not be unreasonably withheld, shall be required where ownership or control of more than ten (10) per cent of the right of control of or interest in the franchise or in the grantee is acquired by a person or group of persons acting in concert, none of whom already own or control ten (10) per cent or more of such right of control or interest, singularly or collectively. Transfer from a subsidiary to a parent corporation or vice versa shall not be considered change of control. 
At the time a franchise is granted hereunder, and annually thereafter, the grantee shall file with the village a current list of its owners, partners (both general and limited), officers and directors, together with a list of shareholders owning or controlling five (5) per cent or more of its stock if the grantee is a corporation. 
(2)  Any financial institution having a pledge of, or other form of security interest in a franchise, or in the assets of a grantee, for the advancement of money for the construction and/or operation of the BTN, shall notify the village whenever it or its designee satisfactory to the village takes control or operates the BTN. However, such financial institution shall also submit a plan for such operation that will insure continued service and compliance with all franchise obligations during the term the financial institution exercises control over the BTN. The financial institution shall not exercise control over the BTN for a period exceeding one year unless extended by the village board in its discretion and during said period of time it shall have the right to petition the village to transfer said franchise to another grantee. If the village finds that any transfer, after considering the legal, financial, character, technical and other public interest qualities of the applicant, is satisfactory, the village may transfer and assign the rights and obligations of such franchise as in the public interest. The consent of the village to such transfer shall not be unreasonably withheld, provided however, nothing contained herein shall limit any right of the village of first refusal, purchase, or other similar provision which may be included in any franchise agreement. 
(3)  For purposes of this section 7.5-304(i), the term "grantee" shall not include any affiliate of such grantee. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-305. - Selection of grantees. 
(a)  Application for a franchise. Applications for an original franchise granted hereunder shall be filed with the village manager and shall be accompanied by the payment of a nonrefundable filing fee of five hundred dollars ($500.00). Such applications shall contain written information which is responsible to requirements established from time to time by the board of trustees. 
(b)  Acceptance of certain applications. Applications, requests or proposals for a franchise which were submitted to and accepted by the village prior to December 31, 1983, shall be deemed to be in compliance with section 7.5-305(a). Section 7.5-305(a) as it relates to a filing fee shall not be applicable to such applications. 
(c)  Criteria for evaluation of applications. Applications for BTN franchise will be evaluated under the following criteria: 
(1)  Experience. Preference may be given to applicants that can give evidence of providing dependable and complete service to other communities and who have established a record of excellent construction practices, ability to meet deadlines, and good planning and marketing practices. 
(2)  Financial stability. Preference may be given to applicants that present evidence of financial resources which will assure that the applicant will have the ability to complete the entire BTN in the franchise area within the time period set forth in section 7.5-305(a). 
(3)  System design. Preference may be given to a system which contains the flexibility to adjust to new technological development and which indicates that high quality equipment will be used and high quality maintenance practices will be followed. 
(4)  Services. Preference may be given to the applicant that proposes to provide superior programming. In determining what constitutes superior programming, particular consideration will be given to local origination and the resources which an applicant proposes to devote to local origination in order to make it interesting, innovative, and financially feasible. 
(5)  Local facilities. Preference may be given to applicants that propose to maintain studio facilities, and/or district, regional or corporate headquarters, or offices within the village. 
(6)  Rate schedules. Preference may be given to applicants with the most reasonable installation and subscriber rate schedules. However, such schedules must be justified in financial pro forma statements by the use of realistic levels of penetration. 
(7)  Local ownership and control. The degree of local ownership and control of an applicant may be taken into account. 
The foregoing criteria are not listed in any order of priority and shall not limit the village from taking into consideration other factors which may directly or indirectly benefit the village, or potential or existing subscribers. 
(d)  Procedures for granting a franchise. All phases of the franchise process shall be had in accordance with Chapter 7.5, Article I of the Municipal Code of the Village of Villa Park. If the village board determines that a franchise should be granted hereunder, the board will then proceed as follows: 
(1)  The board shall, by motion, make a tentative selection of the applicant. Such action shall not constitute the award of a franchise and shall not confer any rights upon the applicant except to proceed in accordance with this section 7.5-305(d). 
(2)  The proper officers and representatives of the village and the applicant shall discuss the terms of the franchise agreement described in section 7.5-306 of this article. 
(3)  If the village and the applicant reach agreement to the terms and conditions of the franchise agreement, the agreement shall be presented to the village board for approval and authorization for execution by the village president. 
(4)  The board shall then, by ordinance, grant a franchise to the applicant. 
(5)  The decision of the board concerning grantee selection and awarding of any franchise shall be final. 
(e)  Effective date of a franchise. The effective date of a franchise shall be the date on which the ordinance referred to in subsection (4) of section 7.5-305(d) is adopted by the village board. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-306. - Franchise agreement. 
(a)  Agreement required. No franchise shall be granted hereunder unless the applicant and the village have executed a franchise agreement which shall set forth the terms and provisions of the franchise. 
(b)  Contents of agreement. Each franchise agreement shall contain the following express representation by the grantee: 
(1)  The grantee has carefully read the terms and conditions of this article of Chapter 7.5 of the Village Code and the franchise agreement and accepts all of such terms and conditions and agrees to abide by the same. 
(2)  The grantee acknowledges that it has carefully read the terms and conditions of this article and expressly waives any claims that any provisions thereof are unreasonable or arbitrary or void, except as to those provisions which are pre-empted now or hereafter by superseding provisions of federal or state law, in accordance with section 7.5-323(d) of this article. 
(3)  The grantee acknowledges that it has not been induced to accept the franchise by any promise, oral or written, by or on behalf of the village or by any third person, regarding any term or condition of this article or the franchise agreement not expressed therein. 
(4)  The grantee represents that no promise or inducement, oral or written, has been made to any village employee, agent, representative, attorney, consultant or official regarding receipt of the franchise. 
(c)  Additional conditions. In addition to those matters required to be included in the franchise agreement by virtue of this article, the franchise agreement shall contain such further conditions or provisions as may be included in the grantee's proposal and/or negotiated between the village and the grantee, except that no such conditions or provisions shall be such as to conflict with any provisions of this article or other applicable law. In case of such conflict, or in case of any ambiguity between any terms or provisions of the franchise agreement and this article, the words of this article shall control, provided, however, this provision shall not impair in any way the right of the village to revoke any franchise, upon notice and an opportunity to be heard as a consequence of any default in the performance of any of its material obligations under any franchise agreement.  
Sec. 7.5-307. - Franchise fee. 
(a)  Annual franchise payment. Each grantee of a franchise hereunder shall pay to the village an annual fee in the maximum amount approved by the FCC, not to exceed five (5) per cent of the annual gross revenues. Such payment shall be in addition to any other payment, charge, reimbursement, permit fee or bond owed to the village by the grantee and shall not be construed as payment in lieu of real property taxes levied by state, county or local authorities. 
The amount of the franchise fee set forth in this section shall increase to the highest rate that the grantee is paying any other municipality located within fifty (50) miles from the village, provided the FCC has not prohibited the payment of such rate to such other municipality. For the purposes of this section, franchise fees payable by any affiliate, subsidiary, partnership, or wholly owned corporation related to the grantee shall be deemed payable by the grantee so as to trigger an increase in the amount paid to the village. Any successor, lessee or assignee shall be bound by all rate increases and by the provisions of this section. 
The change in the amount of the franchise fee shall go into effect on the date of passage of an ordinance in the other municipality where the grantee, as hereinabove defined, operates. 
To facilitate the implementation of this section, the grantee shall within fifteen (15) days after their passage, send to the village a certified copy of all ordinances granting to grantee, as hereinabove defined, a franchise within fifty (50) miles from the village. 
(b)  Method of computation. The fee payable under section 7.5-307(a) shall be computed on the basis of the grantee's fiscal year. 
(c)  Partial payments. 
(1)  Within thirty (30) days after the end of the first six (6) months of each fiscal year of the grantee, the grantee shall make a partial payment of the annual fee due for that year. Such partial payment shall be equal to the maximum fee amount approved by the FCC, but not in excess of five (5) per cent of the grantee's gross revenues for such six-month period. "Gross revenues" for this purpose shall be determined in the same manner as annual gross revenues. 
(2)  The village and the grantee may agree to a greater number of partial payments in each fiscal year by a provision therefor in the franchise agreement. 
(d)  Time of annual payment. The payment of the amount required under section 7.5-307(a) shall be due not later than ninety (90) days after the end of the fiscal year for which such payment is computed. Such payment shall equal the amount determined under section 7.5-307(a) minus all partial payments theretofore made under section 7.5-307(c). 
(e)  Place of payment. All payments made under this section 7.5-307 shall be made at the office of the treasurer of the village during normal business hours. 
(f)  Certificates. Each payment made pursuant to this section 7.5-307 shall be accompanied by a certificate of an executive officer of the grantee to the effect that the amount of the payment has been correctly determined in accordance with the provisions of this article. 
(g)  Audit rights. The village may at any time or times cause an audit or inspection to be made of the grantee's books and records for the purpose of verifying the correct amount of any payment required under this section 7.5-307. If such an audit discloses a deficiency in the amount paid of three (3) per cent or more of the amount which should have been paid, the grantee shall pay forthwith to the village upon demand the amount of such deficiency plus the cost of such audit, subject, however, to the provisions of section 7.5-325 of this article concerning disputes. 
(h)  Acceptance by village. No acceptance of any payment by the village shall be construed as a release or as an accord and satisfaction of any claim the village may have for further or additional sums payable as a franchise fee under this article or for the performance of any other obligation of the grantee. 
(i)  Failure to make required payment. In the event that any franchise payment or recomputed amount is not made on or before the dates specified herein, grantee shall pay an interest charge, computed from such due date, at the annual rate of ten (10) per cent per annum. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-308. - Nature of the system: Technical standards. 
(a)  General requirements. Except to the extent to which the FCC has pre-empted the field of technical standards, each BTN for which a franchise is granted hereunder shall be designed, installed and operated so as to meet the following general requirements: 
(1)  The system shall be operationally capable of relaying to subscriber terminals those television and radio broadcast signals for the carriage of which the grantee is now or hereafter authorized by the FCC. 
(2)  The system shall consist of a cable network having a minimum initial forward bandwidth in compliance with the technical standards and rules of the FCC; provided that if a reverse or feedback circuit is routed through a subscriber's premises, it shall be connected so as to permit subscriber notification and deactivation. 
(3)  The system shall be capable of continuous twenty-four-hour daily operation. 
(4)  The system shall be operated in such a manner as to avoid causing interference with reception of off-the-air signals by nonsubscribers to the network. 
(5)  The system shall be designed, installed and operated so as to comply with all applicable technical standards and regulations promulgated by the FCC. 
(6)  The system shall be designed, installed and operated so as to assure the delivery to all subscribers of standard color and monochrome signals on the FCC-designated Class I television channels without noticeable picture degradation or visible evidence of color distortion or other forms of interference directly attributable to the performance of the BTN. 
(7)  The system shall be established and constructed in accordance with the highest standards of the art of cable communications and in accordance with the highest standards of the code of conduct with respect to businesses of the size and type of the grantee. 
(b)  Performance monitoring. Except to the extent to which the FCC has pre-empted the field of performance monitoring, the following rules shall apply to the grantee: 
(1)  The performance of each BTN for which a franchise is granted hereunder with respect to the standards set forth in section 7.5-308(a) shall be monitored in accordance with this section 7.5-308(b). 
(2)  Test procedures used in verification of the performance criteria set forth herein, if not as set forth in Paragraph 76.609, Subpart K, of the FCC Rules and Regulations, as may be from time to time amended or revised, shall be in accordance with good engineering practice and shall be fully described in an attachment to the annual certificate filed with the village. 
(3)  To the extent that the report of measurements as required above may be combined with any reports of measurements required by the FCC or other regulatory agencies, the village shall accept such combined reports, provided that all standards and measurements herein or hereafter established by the village are satisfied. 
(4)  Not later than thirteen (13) months after any new or substantially rebuilt portion of the system is made available for service to subscribers, or within such lesser period of time as may be required by the FCC from time to time, technical performance tests shall be conducted by the grantee to demonstrate full compliance with the current technical standards of the FCC. Such tests shall be performed by, or under the supervision of, a qualified registered professional engineer or an engineer with proper training and experience. A copy of the report shall be submitted to the village describing test results, instrumentation, calibration, and test procedures, and the qualifications of the engineer responsible for the tests. 
(5)  The village may require additional tests on the basis of complaints received or other evidence indicating an unresolved controversy or significant noncompliance, and such tests will be limited to the particular matter in controversy. The village will endeavor to so arrange its requirements for such additional tests so as to minimize hardship or inconvenience to grantee or to the subscriber. 
(c)  Interconnections. 
(1)  Whenever it is financially and technically feasible, the grantee shall so construct and operate the network so that the network can be interconnected into all other networks within the village. 
(2)  Wherever it is financially and technically feasible, the grantee shall so construct and operate the network so that the network can be interconnected into all networks adjacent to the village. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-309. - Nature of the system: Services. 
(a)  Carriage of Chicago Area television stations. Unless prohibited by rules and regulations of the FCC, each BTN for which a franchise is granted hereunder shall carry the signals of all television broadcast stations whose specified zone includes the Village of Villa Park. 
(b)  Other channel requirements. Whether or not required by the rules and regulations of the FCC, each BTN for which a franchise is granted hereunder shall: 
(1)  Have a minimum capacity of fifty-two (52) channels; 
(2)  Have the capacity for two-way active communications; 
(3)  Provide at least one noncommercial access channel on which use by educational agencies within the village shall have priority over all other uses; 
(4)  Provide at least one noncommercial access channel on which the village shall have priority over all other uses; 
(5)  Provide at least one noncommercial access channel on which public interest programming, including, but not limited to, not-for-profit hospitals, shall have priority over all other uses; 
(6)  Provide at least one channel, the use of which is available to the public on a leased basis. 
(c)  Service package. Subject to the provisions of section 7.5-309(d), a grantee may offer service packages to subscribers or potential subscribers in such number, description and content as the grantee shall determine, provided that all service packages shall be offered on a nondiscriminatory basis as provided in section 7.5-320(a). 
(d)  Basic service. Each grantee shall offer the basic service as defined in this article. The basic service need not be offered by that name, insofar as subscribers are concerned, but for purposes of this article, the service shall be known as the basic service. The grantee shall not be required to provide the basic service to a subscriber as a condition to the provision of other service packages. The provisions of this section 7.5-309(d) shall not be construed as any effort by the village to regulate the program content of the basic service; the only purpose of this section 7.5-309(d) is to insure that the basic service will be offered to subscribers as one of the grantee's service packages. 
(e)  Public installations and service thereto. 
(1)  The grantee shall connect the BTN to each school, public library, fire station, and such municipal buildings and other public buildings and locations as the village may designate, without charge for installation and maintenance of one basic cable outlet per connection. Such installations shall be made within sixty (60) days of completion of the cable trunk line that would serve those buildings. 
(2)  Any service granted pursuant to subsection (a) above, may be extended by the persons receiving such service to as many areas within the building where the service is granted or its adjacent buildings which are a part of the total complex receiving such service. The person receiving such service shall pay all expenses for any such extension and shall complete such extension so as not to interfere with the operation of the BTN. 
(3)  The grantee shall provide, without charge, the basic service to each installation made pursuant to this section 7.5-309(e)(1). 
(4)  The village shall have the right to install and maintain free of charge, upon the property of any grantee located in the village, its own equipment and/or that of any unit of local government providing services or protection of life or property within the village, including, but not limited to, a police and fire system and emergency services disaster agency, provided that such equipment does not unreasonably interfere with the grantee's establishment, construction, operation and maintenance of the BTN. 
(f)  Emergency alert override. Each grantee shall incorporate into its facilities the capability for a remotely activated emergency override alert system whereby a designee of the village, in times of emergency, may introduce an audio and/or visual message on all BTN channels simultaneously. The village shall hold grantee harmless and indemnify grantee for liability solely and exclusively resulting from the emergency use of the BTN by the village. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-310. - Construction of the system. 
(a)  Construction schedule. 
(1)  Permits. Within thirty (30) days after the effective date of its franchise, the grantee shall file with the appropriate governmental authorities and with the necessary utility companies, all initial papers, applications, contracts and other documents necessary to permit the commencement of construction and operation of the BTN, and shall thereafter make diligent efforts to obtain the proper execution and delivery of such documents. The grantee shall report to the village every thirty (30) days on its progress in obtaining necessary permits, contracts and other necessary documents as contemplated above, and on its construction progress as specified hereinafter. 
(2)  Substantial completion of construction. Within twenty-four (24) months after the effective date of its franchise, the grantee shall have substantially completed the BTN. 
(3)  Midway completion of construction. Within twenty (20) months after the effective date of its franchise, the grantee shall have installed sufficient distribution facilities so as to permit the offering of full network service to at least fifty (50) per cent of the potential subscribers in the franchise territory. 
(4)  Commencement of operation. Within sixteen (16) months after the effective date of its franchise, the grantee shall commence operation. 
(5)  Initiation of services. Within ten (10) months after the effective date of its franchise, the grantee shall have installed sufficient distribution facilities so as to permit the offering of full network service to at least one potential subscriber in the franchise territory. 
(6)  Commencement of construction. Within six (6) months after the effective date of its franchise, the grantee shall commence construction of the BTN. 
(b)  Construction standards. 
(1)  Compliance with safety codes. All construction practices shall be in accordance with all applicable sections of the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 and any amendments thereto, as well as all state and local codes where applicable. 
(2)  Compliance with electrical code. All installation of electronic equipment shall be of a permanent nature, durable and installed in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Village Code, as may be from time to time amended. 
(3)  Antennas and towers. Antenna supporting structures (towers) shall be designed for the proper loading zone as specified in Electronics Industry Association's R.S.-22A Specifications, as may be from time to time amended. 
(4)  Construction standards and requirements. All of the grantee's plant and equipment, including but not limited to the antenna site, head-end and distribution system, towers, house connections, structures, poles, wire, cable, coaxial cable, fixtures and appurtenances, if and to the extent located within the village, shall be installed, located, erected, constructed, reconstructed, replaced, removed, repaired, maintained, and operated in accordance with good engineering practices, and such work shall be performed by experienced maintenance and construction personnel so as not to endanger or interfere with improvements the village may deem proper to make, or to interfere in any manner with the rights of any property owner, or to unnecessarily hinder or obstruct pedestrian or vehicular traffic on village properties. 
(5)  Safety, nuisance requirements. The grantee shall at all times employ ordinary care and shall install and maintain in use commonly accepted methods and devices preventing failures and accidents which are likely to cause damage, injury or nuisance to the public. 
(6)  Experienced personnel. The grantee shall employ only such personnel as have necessary and sufficient skill and experience or training as properly to perform their respective jobs and positions. 
(c)  Street occupancy. 
(1)  Grantee shall utilize existing poles, conduits and other facilities whenever possible, and shall not construct or install new, different, or additional poles, conduits, or other facilities on public property until the written approval of the village is first obtained, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. Grantee shall endeavor to use existing conduits and/or implement augering whenever economically and technically feasible to avoid unnecessary cutting of streets. Grantee shall not acquire any vested interest in any location for any pole or wire holding structure, and such poles or structures shall be removed or modified by the grantee at its own expense whenever the village determines that the public convenience would be enhanced thereby. 
(2)  The facilities of the grantee shall be installed underground in those areas of the village where existing telephone and electric services are both underground at the time of network construction. In areas where either telephone or electric utility facilities are installed aerially at the time of network construction, the grantee may install its facilities aerially with the understanding that at such time as the existing aerial facilities are required to be placed underground by the village, the grantee shall likewise place its facilities underground at its own expense. 
(3)  The grantee shall notify the village at least ten (10) days prior to the intention of the grantee to commence any construction in any streets. The village shall cooperate with the grantee in granting any permits required, providing such grant and subsequent construction by the grantee shall not unduly interfere with the use of such streets and that the proposed construction shall be done in accordance with all applicable provisions of the Villa Park Village Code. 
(4)  All transmission lines, equipment and structures shall be so installed and located as to cause minimum interference with the rights and reasonable convenience of property owners and at all times shall be kept and maintained in a safe, adequate and substantial condition and in good order and repair. The grantee shall at all times employ ordinary care and shall install and maintain in use commonly accepted methods and devices for preventing failures and accidents which are likely to cause damage, injuries, or nuisances to the public. Suitable barricades, flags, lights, flares, or other devices shall be used at such times and places as are reasonably required for the safety of all members of the public. Any poles or other fixtures placed in any public way by the grantee shall be placed in such manner as not to interfere with the usual travel on such public way. 
(5)  Grantee shall restore to village standards and specifications, at its own expense and in a manner approved by the village, any damage or disturbance caused to any street, public way or to public property as a result of its operations or construction on its behalf. Grantee shall guarantee and maintain such restoration for a period of one year against defective materials or workmanship. Grantee shall substantially restore any damage or disturbance to private property which may result from operations or construction by it or on its behalf. 
(6)  Whenever, in case of fire or other disaster, it becomes necessary in the judgment of the village president, village manager, director of public works, civil defense director, police chief, or the fire chief of the Villa Park Fire Department or his lawful successor, to remove or damage any of the grantee's facilities, no charge shall be made by the grantee against the village for restoration and repair, unless such acts amount to gross negligence by the village. 
(7)  Grantee shall have the authority to trim trees on public property at its own expense as may be necessary to protect its wires and facilities, subject to prior notice and supervision and direction of the village. 
(8)  The grantee, at its expense, shall protect, support, temporarily disconnect, relocate, or remove, any property of the grantee when in the opinion of the village manager, the same is required by reason of traffic conditions, public safety, street vacation, street construction, change or establishment of street grade, installation of sewers, drains, waterpipes, power lines, signal lines, transportation facilities, tracks, or any other type of structure or improvement by governmental agencies, whether acting in a governmental or a proprietary capacity, or any other structure or public improvement, including (but not limited to) movement of buildings, renewal of areas within the village, and any general program under which the village shall undertake to cause all such properties to be located beneath the surface of the ground. The grantee shall in all cases have the privilege, subject to the corresponding obligation, to abandon any property of grantee in place. Nothing hereunder shall be deemed a taking of the property of grantee, and grantee shall be entitled to no surcharge by reason of anything hereunder. 
(9)  Upon failure of grantee to commence, pursue or complete any work required by law or by the provisions of this article to be done in any street, within the time prescribed and to the satisfaction of the village manager, the village manager may, at his option, cause such work to be done and the grantee shall pay to the village the cost thereof in the itemized amounts reported by the village manager to grantee, within thirty (30) days after receipt of such itemized report. 
(10)  The grantee shall make no paving cuts or curb cuts unless absolutely necessary, and then only after written permission has been given by the village manager. 
(11)  The grantee shall install in conduit, all cables passing under any roadway. 
(d)  Letter of credit or bond. The grantee shall furnish to the village an irrevocable letter of credit in favor of the village in a form approved by the village's attorney certifying that one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) is and will remain available (until reduced in accordance with this section 7.5-310(d)) at a sound and reputable banking or financial institution, located within fifty (50) miles of the village, (selected by the grantee and approved by the village) authorized to issue such irrevocable letter of credit. The irrevocable letter of credit shall be conditioned upon the faithful performance by the grantee of its obligations under this article and the franchise agreement, including timely compliance with the construction schedule set forth in section 7.5-310(a) of this article or the franchise agreement, whichever provisions are shorter, and shall be reduced in accordance with the following table upon such timely compliance by the grantee: 
If the following construction phase is timely 
completed by the grantee, 
  
_____ 	The dollar amount of the letter of credit 
required by this section 7.5-310(d) shall be 
reduced to the sum of: 
_____ 
Commencement of construction 
(Six (6) months after effective date of franchise) or such lesser time as may be specified or referred to in any franchise agreement 	$100,000.00 
Initiation of services 
(Ten (10) months after effective date of franchise) or such lesser time as may be specified or referred to in any franchise agreement 	80,000.00 
Commencement of operation 
(Sixteen (16) months after effective date of franchise) or such lesser time as may be specified or referred to in any franchise agreement 	70,000.00 
Midway completion of construction 
(Twenty (20) months after effective date of franchise) or such lesser time as may be specified or referred to in any franchise agreement 	60,000.00 
Substantial completion of construction 
(Twenty-four (24) months after effective date of franchise) or such lesser time as may be specified or referred to in any franchise agreement 	50,000.00 
 
When the BTN has been substantially completed, the amount of the letter of credit shall remain fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) and shall be renewed on a yearly basis through the remainder of the term of the franchise, or any renewal or extension thereof, and upon the further condition that in the event the grantee shall fail to comply with any law, code, ordinance or regulation governing the franchise in a material fashion, there shall be recoverable from the irrevocable letter of credit any damages or loss suffered by the village as a result, including the full amount of any compensation, indemnification or cost of removal or abandonment of any property of the grantee, plus a reasonable allowance for attorneys' fees and costs, up to the full amount of the letter of credit. 
The village shall determine whether the grantee has satisfied the conditions of the letter of credit in accordance with the standards and procedures set forth in section 7.5-316 of this article. If no claim shall be made under such letter of credit for five (5) consecutive years, the grantee shall be entitled to a return and cancellation of the letter of credit. Such period may be reduced in any franchise agreement, in the discretion of the board, but such reduced period shall not be less than the period required for the completion of construction. 
In the sole discretion of the board a performance bond, from a reputable bonding company doing business in Illinois, in a form acceptable to the village's attorney may be accepted in lieu of a letter of credit in the amount aforesaid. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-311. - Operation and maintenance of the system. 
(a)  Repair. Any damage caused by the grantee's negligence shall be repaired fully by the grantee. 
(b)  Office and phone for service. The grantee shall maintain an office in the village which shall be open during all usual business hours, shall have a locally listed telephone and shall be so operated that complaints and requests for repairs or adjustments may be received at any time. Alternatively, the franchise may designate an agent, who has an office in the village, who is authorized to receive complaints and requests for repairs or adjustments. In addition, the grantee shall maintain a convenient service in the village during normal business hours for the receipt of sums due by its subscribers and shall provide for regular billing of accounts. 
(c)  Notification of service procedures. The grantee shall furnish each subscriber at the time service is installed written instructions that clearly set forth procedures for placing a service call, or requesting an adjustment, or making a complaint or request. 
(d)  Service response time. The grantee shall use its best efforts to provide prompt service response for all complaints and requests for repairs or adjustments. In no event shall response time exceed twenty-four (24) hours except in circumstances beyond the reasonable control of the grantee. 
(e)  Service interruptions and notification. The grantee shall interrupt system service after 7:00 a.m. and before 1:00 a.m. only with good cause and for the shortest time possible, and except in emergency situations, only after publishing notice of service interruption in a newspaper of general circulation in the village at least twenty-four (24) hours in advance of the service interruption. Service may be interrupted between 1:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. for routine testing, maintenance, and repair, without notification, any night except Friday, Saturday or Sunday, or any night preceding any legal holiday. 
(f)  Request for removal or change. 
(1)  The grantee shall, on the request of any person holding a building moving permit issued under the provisions of the Village Code, temporarily raise or lower its wires to permit the moving of said building. The expense of such temporary removal, raising or lowering of wires, shall be paid by the person requesting the same, and the Grantee shall have the authority to require such payment in advance. The grantee shall be given not less than fifteen (15) days advance notice of any move contemplated to arrange for temporary wire changes. 
(2)  The village shall notify the grantee at least ten (10) days prior to the intention of the village to commence any construction in the streets that requires the relocation of grantee's lines, wires or other network appurtenances so as not to interfere with such construction. 
(3)  In the event that permanent use of a street is denied to the grantee by the village for any reason, the grantee shall provide service to affected subscribers over alternate routes within a reasonable period of time. 
(g)  Subscriber's right to cancel service. 
(1)  Any subscriber shall have the right to cancel any or all service packages upon thirty (30) days written notice to the grantee. 
(2)  Upon termination of service to any subscriber, the grantee shall promptly remove all of its facilities and equipment from the subscriber's premises upon his request. 
(h)  Abandonment of service. 
(1)  After grantee has established service pursuant to this article in the franchise area, such service shall not be suspended or abandoned in the whole or any part of the franchise area unless the suspension or abandonment is authorized in writing by the village board. 
(2)  Whenever grantee shall file with the village board a written application alleging that the public interest no longer requires that grantee furnish service pursuant to this article in the whole or in any part of the franchise area, the village board may take evidence upon that question and make a finding with respect to it. If the village board shall find that the public interest no longer requires that the grantee furnish service, the village board may authorize suspension or abandonment of service upon such reasonable terms and conditions as may be prescribed by the village board. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-312. - Rates and charges. 
(a)  Rates and service schedules. The grantee shall at all times maintain on file with the village a complete and current schedule showing all services being provided under the grantee's franchise, the fees and charges for each of such services, the charges for connections or disconnections, and any other charges which may be made by the grantee in connection with the BTN. Such schedule shall also show the components of the basic service and the pay service, each on a channel-by-channel basis, the monthly charge for each service package, and reasonably complete description of each service package. 
(b)  Initial rates. The rates and charges initially charged by a grantee for each of its service packages, as shown in the first schedule filed under section 7.5-312(a), shall be the same as shown or referred to in any franchise agreement, or in the absence of any provision in any franchise agreement, then as proposed in any grantee's application, proposal, or request. Such rates and charges shall not be increased until the later of the following dates: 
(1)  The date which is thirty (30) months subsequent to the effective date of the grantee's franchise, and 
(2)  The date which is two (2) years after the grantee has at least fifty (50) per cent of the system activated and serving subscribers. 
(c)  Modification of rates. 
(1)  After the later of the dates specified in section 7.5-312(b), the grantee may modify its rates from time to time by filing a revised schedule in accordance with section 7.5-312(a). 
(2)  Each rate adjustment and the establishment of a charge for a new or different service shall become effective on the date designated by the grantee in the schedule, provided, that such date may not be less than sixty (60) days from the date on which the schedule was filed, and provided, further, that this section 7.5-312(c) is subject to the provision of section 7.5-312(d). 
(d)  Regulation of rates. It is presently the policy of the village not to regulate rates charged by a grantee for any of its services. However, the village expressly reserves the right to regulate, to the extent permitted by law, any increase in the grantee's rates beyond those rates regarding which a schedule has been filed pursuant to section 7.5-312(c) herein. At the time of each hearing conducted pursuant to section 7.5-315(a), the village shall consider whether to regulate rates. If the village determines at any of such times to regulate rates, this article shall be amended to provide for appropriate standards and hearings in order that such rates may be fairly and equitably determined. Each franchise granted hereunder shall be subject to the village's right to amend this article for the purpose stated in this section 7.5-312(d). Such right shall be exercised at the sole discretion of the village. Nothing contained in this article shall relieve any grantee from complying with any rate schedule which may be included or referred to in any franchise agreement. 
(e)  Disconnections. No charge may be made for disconnection from the BTN. However, if a subscriber has failed to pay properly due monthly fees, or if a subscriber disconnects for seasonal period, the grantee may require, in addition to full payment of any delinquent amounts, a reasonable fee for reconnection to the system. 
(f)  No consideration beyond schedule. A grantee shall not receive any consideration whatsoever for or in connection with its provision of service to its subscribers other than as set forth in this section or in the schedule then on file with the village. 
(g)  Abatement of charges. Upon subscriber's request, charges shall abate pro rata in the event that service to a subscriber is interrupted for more than forty-eight (48) continuous hours for any reason whatsoever except interruption caused by the subscriber. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-313. - Records and reports. 
(a)  Records required. Each grantee shall at all times maintain: 
(1)  A record of all complaints received and interruptions or degradation of service experienced for the preceding three (3) years. 
(2)  A full and complete set of plans, records and "as built" maps showing the exact location of all BTN equipment installed or in use in the village (exclusive of subscriber service drops). 
(3)  Financial records of the grantee in connection with its activities within the village maintained in a manner distinguishing revenues earned within the village from revenues earned by the grantee in other municipalities. 
(b)  Reports required. Each grantee shall file with the village the following reports: 
(1)  Reports to be filed within ninety (90) days after the end of each fiscal year of the grantee: 
a.  An "annual report of cable television systems" (FCC Form 325, Schedules 1 and 2). 
b.  An ownership report indicating all persons who at any time during the preceding year controlled or benefited from an interest in the franchise of ten (10) per cent or more. This report shall also include all creditors secured by pledges or other form of security interest in the BTN and all unsecured creditors whose claims in respect to the operation of the franchise in the village exceed fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00). 
c.  A summary list of all complaints and requests, and BTN "down time" received or experienced during the year, provided, however, the grantee shall maintain for a period of at least three (3) years complete records identifying the person making the complaint or request, the subject matter thereof, and the resolution of the matter in question or the action taken by the grantee. 
d.  A report showing or containing: 
(i)  The total number of hours of utilization of each of the channels described in items (4), (5) and (6) of Section 7.5-309(b); 
(ii)  The number of persons subscribing to two-way service; and 
(iii)  A brief statement indicating whether grantee is planning any new services for the ensuing years as a result of technological development in the cable television industry. 
e.  An annual report of the annual gross revenue of the grantee, prepared, certified and audited by an independent certified public accountant to be selected by the grantee and approved by the village. 
(2)  Reports and certificates to be filed promptly after the indicated event occurs: 
a.  A copy of all petitions and applications filed or submitted by the grantee with any governmental entity or agency having jurisdiction with respect to any matter affecting the BTN or the grantee's undertaking; with respect to this article. 
b.  Written evidence of the payment of each premium for each policy of insurance required hereunder. 
(c)  Documents required. Each grantee shall file with the village within thirty (30) days after the end of each of such grantee's fiscal years a true copy of the most current form of each of the following documents: 
(1)  The letter of credit or bond required hereunder. 
(2)  All policies of insurance or certificates thereof required hereunder. 
(3)  All rules, regulations, and policy statements adopted by the grantee in operating the BTN. 
(d)  Filing. When not otherwise prescribed herein, all matters required to be filed with the village shall be filed with the village manager. 
(e)  Inspection of property and records. At all reasonable times, grantee shall permit examination by any duly authorized representative of the village, of all franchise property, together with any appurtenant property of grantee situated within or without the village. The grantee shall also permit any duly authorized representative of the village to examine and transcribe any and all maps and other records kept or maintained by grantee or under its control concerning the operations, affairs, transactions or property of grantee. If any of such maps or records are not kept in the village, or upon reasonable request made available in the village, and if the village manager shall determine that an examination of such maps or records is necessary or appropriate to the performance of any of his duties, then all travel and maintenance expense necessarily incurred in making such examination shall be paid by the grantee. 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-314. - Indemnification and insurance. 
(a)  Indemnification agreement. The following shall be contained in or incorporated by reference within any franchise agreement: 
"The grantee hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and save whole and harmless the village and its officers, boards, commissions, agents, attorneys and employees from all liabilities and related expenses (including reasonable attorney's fees and the costs or liabilities of the village with respect to its employees) of any kind which may arise out of or from or in connection with the establishment, construction, operation and maintenance of the BTN or the execution and implementation of Article III of Chapter 7.5 of the Village Code of the Village of Villa Park or the ordinance amending the Village Code creating said article, or the granting of a franchise to the grantee by the village, or the exercise of or the enjoyment of its franchise by the grantee. The village shall notify the grantee in the event any person shall in any way notify the village of any claim or demand from which the grantee may be subject to liability under this section or otherwise. The undertaking of grantee in connection with section 7.5-314(a) of the Village Code of the Village of Villa Park includes, but is not limited to, all liabilities or claims of liability with respect to property damage, personal injury or death, invasions of the right of privacy, defamation of any person, antitrust violations, any unfair business practice or any fraud, the violation or infringement of any copyright, trademark, trade name, service mark or patent (including damages arising out of any failure by the grantee to secure consents from the owners, authorized distributors or licensees of programs to be delivered by the grantee's BTN), or of any other right of any person, and failure of the grantee to comply with the provisions of any federal, state or local statute, code, ordinance, rule or regulation applicable to the grantee in connection with said article or in connection with its franchise or operations. Without limitation of the foregoing, the undertaking of the grantee in connection with said section 7.5-314(a) shall include, but not be limited to, costs and expenses for accountant fees, expert witness and consultant fees, court reporter fees, court costs, per diem expenses, traveling and transportation expenses." 
(b)  Insurance. The grantee shall keep the BTN continuously insured against such risks as are customarily insured against by businesses of like size and type, including, but not limited to: 
(1)  Insurance upon the repair or replacement basis if available, and otherwise to the full insurable value of the BTN (with reasonable deductible provisions) against loss or damage by fire and lightning, with uniform standard extended coverage endorsement, limited only as may be provided in the standard form of extended coverage endorsement at the time in use in the state. 
(2)  Boiler explosion insurance on steam boilers, pressure vessels and pressure piping in an amount not less than repair or replacements costs (with reasonable deductible provisions), provided that such insurance need not be taken out until the steam boilers, pressure vessels and pressure piping have been installed in the BTN. 
(3)  Insurance to the extent of two million dollars ($2,000,000.00) per occurrence against liability for bodily injury including death and to the extent of five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000.00) per occurrence against liability for damages to property including loss of use, occurring on, arising out of or in any way related to the BTN. Such policy shall name as additional insureds the village, its officers, boards, commissions, agents and employees. 
(4)  During any period of construction, adequate coverage to meet liability under the Illinois Structural Work Act. 
(5)  Workmen's compensation insurance within statutory limits and employer's liability insurance of not less than one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00). 
(6)  Comprehensive automobile liability insurance to the extent of one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) per occurrence against liability for bodily injury including death and to the extent of three hundred thousand dollars ($300,000.00) per occurrence against liability for damage to property including loss of use occurring on, arising out of, or in any way related to the BTN. 
This section 7.5-314(b) shall not be a limit on the grantee's undertaking provided in section 7.5-314(a). Such insurance shall be issued by a company or companies mutually acceptable to the grantee and the village in a form satisfactory to the village and shall list the Village of Villa Park, its officers, boards, commissions, committees, agents and employees as additional insureds. 
(c)  Notice of cancellation or reduction of coverage. The insurance policies referred to above shall contain a broad form contractual liability endorsement and shall also contain the following endorsement: 
"It is hereby understood and agreed that this policy may not be cancelled nor the amount of coverage thereof reduced until thirty (30) days after receipt by the Village of Villa Park by registered mail of written notice of such intent to cancel or reduce the coverage." 
(Ord. No. 2103, § 1, 3-19-84)  
Sec. 7.5-315. - Reviews, modifications and renewal of the franchise. 
(a)  Three-year reviews. On or about the third, sixth, ninth, and twelfth anniversaries of the effective date of the franchise grant, the village board shall schedule and hold a special public meeting or meetings with the grantee to review the performance by the grantee under the franchise, including future plans of the grantee regarding operation and performance. In particular, the village may inquire whether the grantee is supplying a level and variety of services equivalent to those being generally offered at that time in the industry in comparable market situations. At such meeting, the village board may consider whether the rates of the grantee should be regulated.
